title: (x) MTA MetroCard in New York - Helvetica {Marc O}
content:
I'd appreciate some help in identifying all the fonts (call me greedy ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)) used on the MTA MetroCard, used to pay fare to board the subway, below:   
   
 ![MTA MetroCard](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/43001.gif)
author: jareha

comments.content: The perspective makes it hard to tell for sure, but "MetroCard" looks like Helvetica Black.
Everything associated with MTA is set in a variation of Helvetica. Wait until next year when you have your big type conference in NYC and ride the subway the poster will make you upchuck.

Thanks Marc.   
   
Actually Yves, I'm looking to forge...a business card. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095310im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Daniel, if "[e]verything associated with MTA is set in a variation of Helvetica" this case is closed then, right?
MTA has been using Helvetica as long as I can remember. Didn't Vignelli (Helvetica king) have something to do with it originally?
